ch.nolix.common.mathematics

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.common.mathematics.Matrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ApproximativeEqualing

    public final class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements ApproximativeEqualing
    This class represents a matrix of doubles. A matrix has at least 1 row and 1 column. All comparisons a matrix does with its values are approximative. For example: -The second row of the matrix [4, 5; 0.000000001, 0] counts as zero row. -The matrix [0.9999999999, 0; 0, 1] counts as identity matrix.

      • getMinimalFactorMatrix

        public final Matrix getMinimalFactorMatrix(Matrix productMatrix)
        This method implements the least squares algorithm.
        Parameters:
        productMatrix -
        Returns:
        a matrix A so that the matrix X*A-Y is minimal -X is this matrix -Y is the given solution matrix
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if: -the given solution matrix has not 1 column -the given solution matrix has not as many rows as this matrix

      • getProduct

        public final Matrix getProduct(Matrix matrix)
        Parameters:
        matrix -
        Returns:
        the product of this matrix and the given matrix
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the given matrix has not as many rows as this matrix columns has This implementation has a complexity of O(m*n*p) if this matrix has m rows and n columns and the given matrix has n rows p columns.
